newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait share index rises 5.9 pct in April mo/mo.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait share index rises 5.9 pct in April mo/mo.

text.p: The Kuwait Stock Exchange (KSE) index rose 5.9 percent month-on-month in April to 2,336.6 points, official figures showed on Monday.

Value of traded shares fell 15.2 percent in April from the previous month to 1.07 billion dinars. Trade volume dropped 18.5 percent to four billion shares, according to an official KSE monthly report.
Investment firms were the most active by value accounting for 39 percent of the total for April, real estate firms followed with 35.7 percent and banks came third with 10 percent.
Real estate firms were the most active by volume with 38 percent of the total followed by investment firms with 37.4 percent and non-Kuwait firms 13.5 percent.

Only nationals of the six Gulf Arab states -- Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Oman, Bahrain, the United Arab Emirates and Qatar -- are allowed to trade on the KSE. Expatriates living in Kuwait can participate through mutual funds managed by local firms.
